intro: Cacalia carduoides, commonly known as the prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, spiny leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, allowing it to spread easily in new locations.
